issue.title: [C++] add(date, duration) -> timestamp kernel
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14091](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14091). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Issue to track implementation of addition of dates and intervals.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14091?focusedCommentId=17419186) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Would it be better if the kernel has predictable return type, not depending on the values?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14091?focusedCommentId=17419240) by Phillip Cloud (cpcloud):*
Good call, I changed the return type to `timestamp`

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14091?focusedCommentId=17489637) by David Li (lidavidm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 12377
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12377>
